sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's Wednesday the 9th of February. Good morning Europe, a very warm welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After a meeting in Berlin, German, French and Polish leaders say they stand firm together, determined to avoid war between Russia and Ukraine and to preserve peace in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: More European countries ease travel measures just as protests against mandatory Covid vaccinations grow into a political movement and a long-running dispute between czech republic and poland over the environmental costs of the two-row coal mine reach an agreement germany france and pol Poland are united in their goal of preserving peace in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who welcomed presidents Emmanuel Macron and Andrei Duda to Berlin on Tuesday evening to discuss the Ukrainian crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While diplomatic talks continue, many European countries have strengthened their defence systems and have threatened Russia with crippling sanctions if it launches an attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The deployment of Russian troops on the border with Ukraine is very worrying and our assessment of the situation here is identical, as is our stance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A further breach of Ukraine's territorial integrity and sovereignty is unacceptable and would have far-reaching consequences for Russia politically, economically and certainly also geostrategically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have to find a solution to avoid war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As I've said, this is currently our main task.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I believe that we will achieve it." Moscow has amassed some 130,000 troops near Ukraine's border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While Russian fighter jets were sighted near state lines on Tuesday, conducting aerial military exercises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, the Kremlin insists it has no plans to invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes as the Russian Defense Ministry recently published footage of warships preparing to conduct military drills in the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ministry stressed that three more vessels will be added to the fleet and that the operation is part of a large-scale naval exercise in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After weeks of relative silence here in Berlin during the time that Russia has

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: built up troops along the Ukrainian border, all of a sudden there is a diplomatic marathon kicking off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz holding meetings here in Berlin with the Polish president Duda, with Macron of France and also with Michel, the EU Council President and the Prime Minister of Denmark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz is clearly ready, perhaps because of the criticism that he has been to, invisible, clearly ready to take a larger role in this crisis and he's being seen more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The question is, is he being heard? There is a difference between the way he approaches this crisis, refusing to firmly rule out shutting down the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline if Russia attacks Ukraine, for example, refusing to send arms to Ukraine, another example.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And there is a difference between that approach and the approach of some of his allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He is obviously hoping that he can be both seen and heard and that the German approach can quiet down the critics but also make an impact during this crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Jonah Kellgren, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Prior to talks in Berlin, French President Emmanuel Macron visited Ukraine to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Euronews international correspondent Anneliese Borges sent this report from eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After offering Moscow he described as concrete security guarantees French President Emmanuel Macron traveled to Ukraine's capital, Kiev, to reinforce France's and Europe's commitment towards this country's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron said that his objective here was to restore order, security and stability in the region and in the whole of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that for that, there are concrete steps, according to the French president, that can be taken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said that while the de-escalation of the current military tension is very important and that it took a lot of cold blood to stay calm when you have 125,000 troops amassed by your border, there are more profound issues, according to Emmanuel Macron, that also needed to be addressed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said that he got assurances from both Putin and Zelensky over the importance of the Minsk agreements and highlighted that meeting between political advisers set to take place this week under the Normandy format.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He also hinted at the possibility of a higher level meeting taking place over the next few weeks. And while the idea of Zelensky and Putin in the same room seems quite far-fetched at the moment, this seems to be what Emmanuel Macron will be working towards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said a resolution to this crisis will take time, but that we are entering a new process, a new phase during which words will matter as much as actions annelise borges in ukraine's east for euronews as school half-term holidays loom or have even started across much of europe

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: the thoughts of many covid weary families are of getting away And with an eye on their own tourist industries, some governments are beginning to relax travel restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vaccinated visitors travelling to Portugal will no longer need to provide a negative test result to enter, although unvaccinated passengers will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Greece has also dropped pre-departure test requirements for fully vaccinated arrivals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, as with many other EU states, it will require those that have had their second jab more than 270 days ago to have had a booster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Good news for UK visitors to France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The government has also announced it will soon drop its requirement of a negative COVID test for vaccinated travellers from outside the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's if daily infection numbers continue to fall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Once in Italy, mandatory mask wearing in public places is being eased in response to an improving coronavirus situation. Spain is also scrapping its mandate to wear masks outdoors but with caution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Remember that face masks will continue to be compulsory indoors and also at events organised outdoors for example a concert and standing or seated events where a 1.5 metre distance cannot be guaranteed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But as many of us have learnt the hard way, before setting off, check the regulations of your destination and remember, things can so easily change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: An anti-vaxxer blockade at the busiest border crossing between the US and Canada has been partially reopened, allowing US-bound traffic to pass. But Canadian lawmakers are still anxious over the economic effects of the disruptive demonstrations. With loaded lorries having to make a five-hour detour to cross the border, the protests are threatening supplies of fresh produce, livestock as well as auto parts and other goods. The so-called Freedom Convoy began last month in response to a rule that requires truck drivers to be vaccinated against Covid-19 to cross the US-Canada border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It has since attracted members of the far-right and homophobic groups. Hundreds of trucks have brought the capital Ottawa to a standstill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was jeered at in Parliament for his handling of the crisis for allowing a small anti-Covid regulation minority to disrupt a country with one of the highest vaccination rates in the world. In a tweet, Trudeau said Canadians have a right to protest but don't have the right to blockade the economy and democracy and that it has to stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Demonstrations have also spread to other Canadian cities and internationally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There have been rallies of support in New Zealand's capital Wellington.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A convoy of trucks and camper vans blocked streets near the parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Some plastered with messages such as give us back our freedom and coercion is not consent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hear ye, hear ye, hear ye. All persons are commanded to keep silent on pain of imprisonment while the Senate of the United States is sitting in the trial of the articles of impeachment exhibited by the House of Representatives against Donald John Trump, President of the United States.
